page.title: 03Filleigh Mills
page.content: Filleigh Mill was built in 1747 as a flour mill (water mill). In 1922 it became a sawmill for the Fortescue estate. The workforce varies between three and seven men in the sawmill itself and seven to ten men in the forestry side. The wood used is mainly Douglas Fir from the 1,200 acres of forestry land. They produce fencing, shed timber, picnic tables etc. A house called 3, Mays Leary, was also once a mill. When the mill was working the men used to jump on the millwheel while it was moving and walk on it. A workman's young son attempting this while the men were away at lunch. Unfortunately he was too small and fell down the side and was crushed to death.
